[vc_row][vc_column width=”2/3″][vc_column_text]Overview :

Dentists diagnose and treat problems with teeth and tissues in the mouth, along with giving advice and administering care to help prevent future problems. They provide instruction on diet, brushing, flossing, the use of fluorides, and other aspects of dental care. They also perform corrective surgery on gums and supporting bones to treat gum diseases.

Periodontics:
It means the branch of dentistry dealing with health & disease of tissues investing and supporting the teeth. Periodontal diseases are infectious diseases caused by bacteria, present in mouth. The most important causative factor is Dental Plaque, which is soft deposit present on teeth, due to lack of proper cleaning of teeth. Periodontal disease is a chronic problem. Without ongoing treatment the infection and disease will reoccur, and each time it does, more bone can be lost, until eventually the teeth become loose and need to be removed. The consequence of these infections ranges from simple bleeding gums to early loss of teeth.

Oral Sedation Dentistry:
Sedation is the reduction of irritability or agitation by administration of sedative drugs, generally to facilitate a diagnostic  procedure or dental procedure. It  involve the administration of oral sedative drugs, to reduce patients fear and anxiety related to the experience. Oral sedation is often  required  during  pediatric/child  dental treatments.

Bruxism /Night Grinding Treatment :

Bruxism is a common sleep disorder which is also known as night time teeth grinding or clenching and is known to affect millions of people. In some cases, bruxism is mild enough not to be a problem, but in severe cases, bruxism can lead to permanent tooth damage in a short amount of time.One of the more common treatments available is mouth guards and splints. It is worn on  a long term basis during sleep at night.

Snoring:
Snoring is the vibration of respiratory structures and the resulting sound, due to obstructed air movement during breathing while sleeping. Snoring during sleep may be a sign, or first alarm, of obstructive sleep apnea (OSA).

The irregular airflow is caused by a passageway blockage and usually due to one of the following:

  • Throat weakness, causing the throat to close during sleep
  • Mispositioned jaw, often caused by tension in the muscles
  • Fat gathering in and around the throat
  • Enlarged tonsil

PRP (Platelet-rich plasma) :

Platelet-rich plasma (PRP) is a new approach to tissue regeneration and it is becoming a valuable adjunct to promote healing in many procedures in dental surgery, especially in aging patients.

PRP derives from the centrifugation of the patient’s own blood and it contains growth factors that influence wound healing, thereby playing an important role in tissue repairing mechanisms. The use of PRP in surgical practice  have beneficial outcomes in :

*Reducing bleeding

*Enhancing soft tissue healing and  bone regeneration.

Our Dentist at Smile Dental Care have yielded promising results regarding the application of PRP to many dental and oral surgical procedures (i.e. tooth extractions, periodontal surgery, implant surgery).
